alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Osage, northwestern Creek, Washington, western Nowata, southeastern Pawnee and northwestern Tulsa Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 430 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Elgin to near Pawhuska to 3 miles north of Cleveland to 2 miles northwest of Jennings. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Bartlesville... Sand Springs... Pawhuska... Skiatook... Hominy... Dewey... Cleveland... Mannford... Drumright... Barnsdall... Sperry... Oilton... Copan... Ramona... Wynona... Ochelata... Jennings... Avant... Westport... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
